user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of UtTest_AddCommon:
```c
void UtTest_AddCommon(void (*Test)(void), void (*Setup)(void), void (*Teardown)(void), const char *TestName,
                      uint32 EntryType)
{
    UtTestDataBaseEntry_t UtTestDataBaseEntry;

    memset(&UtTestDataBaseEntry, 0, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry));
    UtTestDataBaseEntry.Test     = Test;
    UtTestDataBaseEntry.Setup    = Setup;
    UtTestDataBaseEntry.Teardown = Teardown;
    if (TestName != NULL)
    {
        strncpy(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName, TestName, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry.TestName) - 1);
    }

    UT_BSP_Lock();
    UtList_Add(UtAssert_Global.DataBasePtr, &UtTestDataBaseEntry, sizeof(UtTestDataBaseEntry_t), EntryType);
    UT_BSP_Unlock();
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No compiler language extensions are used in the provided code. The code uses only standard C constructs: function-pointer parameters (void (*Test)(void), etc.), standard library calls (memset, strncpy), the sizeof operator, local automatic objects (UtTestDataBaseEntry), and calls to project functions (UT_BSP_Lock, UtList_Add, UT_BSP_Unlock). Identifiers such as uint32 and UtTestDataBaseEntry_t appear to be typedefs (project or stdint-style) rather than compiler-specific language extensions. There are no occurrences of known compiler extensions (for example: __attribute__, __asm, __inline or __inline__, __extension__, typeof, statement expressions, #pragma GCC diagnostic, anonymous/unnamed language-extension constructs, or other vendor-specific keywords). Therefore there are no fragments that require investigation under MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2.
